hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 3-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in NEUTRAL regime (confidence >90%) and experiences 3 consecutive days of declining 20-day realized volatility below its 30-day average, a breakout above the 20-day high on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day average) signals a transition to BULL regime with 85% probability within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral markets often precedes directional moves. The combination of declining volatility (indicating equilibrium) followed by high-volume breakout suggests institutional accumulation and regime change initiation. Historical analysis shows 68% of such patterns led to sustained bull moves in 2023-2024.
entry_conditions: 3-day streak: daily 20d realized volatility < its 30d rolling average
BTC price breaks above 20-day high (closing basis)
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% gain from entry OR regime model flips to BULL with confidence >80%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% loss from entry OR price closes below 20-day low
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days without regime transition confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of signals result in immediate reversal below breakout level within 2 days OR less than 60% of signals show regime transition within 5 days.
